metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7837 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in BlueZ 5.41 and earlier allows an attacker to executearbitrary code via the parse_line function used in some userland utilities.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7837` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-cups - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-hcidump - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-obexd - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
bluez-tests - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
libbluetooth3 - 5.37-0ubuntu5.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bluez package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.37-0ubuntu5.3').
